au-alert.name: au-alert

severity.description: Visual severity level, controls color and icon

dismissible.description: Shows a close button to dismiss the alert

tips: Use severity for visual styling
Add dismissible for X button

au-api-table.name: au-api-table
au-api-table.description: API documentation table showing component properties, events, or methods

type.description: Type of API items to display

tips: Internal component used in demo documentation

au-avatar.name: au-avatar
au-avatar.description: Circular avatar showing image, initials, or icon
tips: Automatically shows initials when image fails to load

au-badge.name: au-badge
au-badge.description: Small status indicator badge, attach to other components

variant.description: Color variant using MD3 system colors

size.description: Badge size (sm=dot indicator, md=with text content)

tips: Place inside a parent element with position: relative for overlay positioning

au-bottom-nav.name: au-bottom-nav
au-bottom-nav.description: Mobile bottom navigation bar with icon + label items

hide-on-desktop.description: Hides the bottom nav on desktop viewports (>= 600px)

tips: Best for mobile layouts â€” shows at screen bottom with up to 5 items

au-button.name: au-button
au-button.description: Material Design 3 button component with ripple effect

variant.description: Visual style. Use filled/elevated/tonal for emphasis, outlined/text for secondary actions, danger for destructive.

disabled.description: Disables the button and prevents clicks

tips: Use textContent to update label dynamically
Use data-i18n attribute for internationalization
Add disabled attribute while processing async actions
Icon-only buttons MUST have aria-label for accessibility, e.g. <au-button aria-label="Edit"><au-icon name="edit"></au-icon></au-button>

gotchas: Event listeners on buttons inside au-modal are LOST â€” the modal clones innerHTML into a native <dialog>
Use event delegation on the au-modal element: modal.addEventListener('click', e => { if (e.target.closest('#save-btn')) ... })

au-callout.name: au-callout
au-callout.description: Highlighted content block for notes, warnings, or tips

variant.description: Visual severity level, controls color and icon

examples: <au-callout variant="warning" title="Important">Please save your work before proceeding.</au-callout>
tips: Similar to GitHub alerts â€” use for docs and guides

au-card.name: au-card
au-card.description: Material Design 3 card container with elevation and padding options

variant.description: Visual style. elevated=shadow, outlined=border, filled=background color.

padding.description: Inner padding size (none=0, sm=8px, md=16px, lg=24px)

tips: Use variant="elevated" for prominent cards with shadow
Use variant="outlined" for cards with border only
Nest au-stack or au-grid inside for complex layouts

au-checkbox.name: au-checkbox
au-checkbox.description: Material Design 3 checkbox with indeterminate state support

disabled.description: Disables the checkbox and prevents user interaction

indeterminate.description: Visual "partial" state, cleared on user click

tips: Use .checked property to get/set state
indeterminate is visual only, cleared on user interaction
Listen to au-change for state updates

gotchas: In loops, use document.createElement('au-checkbox') instead of innerHTML to avoid re-triggering connectedCallback
Use a _isRendering guard when updating lists inside au-change handlers to prevent infinite loops

au-chip.name: au-chip
au-chip.description: Material Design 3 chip component - toggleable tag or static badge

selected.description: Whether the chip is in selected state

removable.description: Shows remove button (X) and emits au-remove on click

static.description: Non-interactive display mode (badge). Disables toggle, ripple, and keyboard activation.

tips: Use static for display-only badges (priority, status, labels)
Use default (no static) for filter chips the user can toggle
Use removable for tags the user can dismiss

au-code.name: au-code
au-code.description: Code block with syntax highlighting and copy-to-clipboard
tips: Place code as text content inside the element

au-confirm.name: au-confirm
au-confirm.description: Confirmation dialog with Promise-based API. Use auConfirm() for one-liner async confirms.

confirm-text.description: Label for the confirm action button

cancel-text.description: Label for the cancel action button

variant.description: Visual style of the confirm button (danger for destructive actions)

open.description: Whether the confirmation dialog is visible

examples: const ok = await auConfirm('Delete this item?');
const ok = await auConfirm('Are you sure?', { title: 'Confirm Delete', variant: 'danger' });
tips: Use the auConfirm() function for Promise-based one-liners
Variant "danger" shows a red confirm button

au-container.name: au-container
au-container.description: Responsive content container with max-width and centering

size.description: Maximum width of the container (sm=640px, md=768px, lg=1024px, xl=1280px, full=100%)

padding.description: Inner padding size (none=0, sm=8px, md=16px, lg=24px)

center.description: Centers the container with auto margins (on by default). Set center="false" to disable.

tips: Use as outer wrapper for page content with consistent max-width

au-datatable.name: au-datatable
au-datatable.description: AI-First smart data table with built-in sorting, pagination, filtering, and row selection

columns.description: JSON array of column definitions [{field, label, sortable, filterable}]

filterable.description: Shows a search/filter input above the table

empty-message.description: Message shown when the table has no rows

tips: Set data via setData() method, not attributes
Use filterable attribute to enable built-in search
Columns support custom render functions for formatting

au-divider.name: au-divider

vertical.description: Renders the divider vertically instead of horizontally

inset.description: Adds horizontal margin to inset the divider from the container edges

tips: Use inset for padded dividers inside lists

au-doc-page.name: au-doc-page
au-doc-page.description: Documentation page container with auto-generated API tables
tips: Internal component used in the demo site to auto-generate docs

au-drawer-item.name: au-drawer-item
au-drawer-item.description: Navigation item inside au-drawer with icon and label

active.description: Highlights item as the current page

badge.description: Badge text shown beside the label (e.g. notification count)

layout.description: Controls display layout variant of the drawer item

tips: Set active attribute to highlight the current page

au-drawer.name: au-drawer
au-drawer.description: Adaptive navigation drawer â€” expands on desktop, collapses to rail on tablet, modal overlay on mobile

mode.description: Display mode. auto=responsive (desktopâ†’permanent, tabletâ†’rail, mobileâ†’overlay), permanent=always visible, temporary=overlay, rail=collapsed icon strip

open.description: Whether the drawer is expanded. In temporary mode, controls the overlay state.

expand-on-hover.description: In rail mode, expands the drawer to full width on mouse hover

position.description: Which side of the viewport the drawer appears on (logical direction)

examples:
<au-drawer mode="auto">
  <au-drawer-item icon="home" label="Home" href="#home" active></au-drawer-item>
  <au-drawer-item icon="settings" label="Settings" href="#settings"></au-drawer-item>
</au-drawer>
tips: Use mode="auto" for responsive behavior across breakpoints
Call toggle() to open/close on mobile

au-dropdown.name: au-dropdown
au-dropdown.description: Material Design 3 select menu with popover API

placeholder.description: Text shown when no option is selected

disabled.description: Disables the dropdown and prevents opening

tips: Use au-option or standard option children
Listen to au-select for selection changes
Use .value property to get/set selection
.value = 'x' sets the attribute but does NOT update the displayed label â€” use .select(value, label) instead

gotchas: Event listeners on dropdown inside au-modal are LOST â€” use event delegation on au-modal
After modal.open(), use dropdown.select(value, label) to pre-populate â€” .value = does NOT update displayed text
Listen to au-select events via delegation: modal.addEventListener('au-select', e => { ... })

au-error-boundary.name: au-error-boundary
au-error-boundary.description: Catches errors in child components and displays fallback UI

fallback.description: Fallback HTML content to show on error

tips: Prevents one broken component from crashing the entire page

au-example.name: au-example
au-example.description: Component example container used in documentation â€” shows live preview with source code toggle
tips: Internal component used in the demo site

au-fetch.name: au-fetch
au-fetch.description: Declarative data fetching component â€” load remote data with just HTML attributes
tips: Use auto attribute to fetch immediately on page load
Set interval for periodic polling

au-form.name: au-form
au-form.description: Form container with validation and data collection. Use getValues() to read all field data at once.
tips: Use getValues() to collect all named field values as an object
Listen for au-submit event to handle validated form data
Add debug attribute to enable agent validation warnings

au-grid.name: au-grid
au-grid.description: CSS Grid layout container with responsive column support

cols.description: Number of columns or responsive pattern

gap.description: Gap between grid cells using standard spacing tokens

tips: Use cols="auto-fit" for responsive grid that wraps automatically

au-icon.name: au-icon
au-icon.description: Material Design icon component supporting Material Symbols, SVG, and emoji

size.description: Icon size â€” accepts named tokens (xs=16, sm=20, md=24, lg=32, xl=40) or raw pixel values

filled.description: Uses filled variant of Material Symbols icon

font.description: Forces Google Fonts rendering instead of bundled SVG. Use for icons not in the bundled set.

tips: ~60 common icons are bundled as SVG (zero network dependency)
Any other Material Symbols name auto-loads Google Fonts on first use
For emoji, just place it as text content: <au-icon>ðŸš€</au-icon>
Use describe().bundledIcons to see which icons work offline

au-input.name: au-input
au-input.description: Material Design 3 text field with floating label

type.description: HTML input type, determines keyboard and validation behavior

value.description: Current input value. Use .value property for programmatic access.

variant.description: Visual style. outlined=border only, filled=background color.

disabled.description: Disables the input and prevents user interaction

tips: Use .value property to get/set current value
Use .clear() to reset input (e.g. after adding a todo)
Listen to au-input for keystroke-level changes, au-change for committed value
Always provide label for accessibility

gotchas: Event listeners on inputs inside au-modal are LOST â€” use event delegation on au-modal
Read values via modal.querySelector('#my-input').value after the modal is open

au-layout.name: au-layout
au-layout.description: App shell layout container that orchestrates drawer, navbar, and main content areas

has-drawer.description: Auto-detected when <au-drawer> is slotted. Adjusts layout to accommodate sidebar navigation.

has-bottom-nav.description: Auto-detected when <au-bottom-nav> is slotted. Adds padding-bottom compensation to prevent content being hidden behind the nav bar.

full-bleed.description: Removes all content padding for edge-to-edge layouts. Bottom-nav padding compensation is automatically preserved when has-bottom-nav is active.

tips: Use as the root layout for apps with sidebar navigation
Content area has padding: 16px (8px on mobile). Use full-bleed attribute to remove all padding (kanban, maps). Bottom-nav compensation is automatic.
CAUTION: NEVER override padding on .au-layout-content with !important or the padding shorthand â€” it defeats bottom-nav compensation. Use the full-bleed attribute instead.

au-lazy.name: au-lazy
au-lazy.description: Lazy-loading wrapper that renders children only when visible in viewport
tips: Use for below-the-fold content to improve initial load time

au-modal.name: au-modal

open.description: Whether the modal dialog is visible

tips: Use .open() and .close() methods
ESC and backdrop click auto-close
Place action buttons directly inside <au-modal>, not in a slot. Slots are not supported.

WARNING: au-modal copies innerHTML into a native <dialog>. Event listeners on child elements are LOST. Use event delegation: modal.addEventListener('click', e => { if (e.target.closest('#save')) ... })

au-navbar.name: au-navbar
au-navbar.description: Top app bar with brand, navigation links, and action items

sticky.description: Sticks the navbar to the top of the viewport on scroll

variant.description: Visual density. dense reduces height for compact layouts.

tips: Use sticky for fixed top navigation that scrolls with the page

au-page.name: au-page
au-page.description: Route-specific page container used inside au-router

route.description: Route hash this page responds to

tips: Content can be inline or loaded dynamically by au-router

au-progress.name: au-progress

value.description: Current value (0-max or omit for indeterminate)

max.description: Maximum value for the progress bar

variant.description: Color variant using MD3 system colors

tips: Omit value for indeterminate animation
MUST add aria-label for accessibility, e.g. <au-progress aria-label="Task completion" value="50"></au-progress>

au-prompt-ui.name: au-prompt-ui
au-prompt-ui.description: AI chat prompt input with send button â€” for building agent UIs

placeholder.description: Placeholder text for the input field

loading.description: Shows loading state on the send button

disabled.description: Disables the input and send button

tips: Part of the Agent UI toolkit for building chat interfaces

au-radio.name: au-radio
tips: Wrap au-radio items in au-radio-group
Use .value property to get/set selection

au-repeat.name: au-repeat
au-repeat.description: Template repeater that renders child template for each item in a data array
tips: For large lists (1000+ items), use au-virtual-list instead

au-router.name: au-router
au-router.description: Hash-based client-side router that loads page content dynamically
examples:
<au-router base="content/" default="home">
  <au-page route="home" title="Home"></au-page>
  <au-page route="about" title="About"></au-page>
</au-router>
tips: Routes are based on URL hash: #home, #about, etc.
Pages are loaded lazily from the base path

au-schema-form.name: au-schema-form
au-schema-form.description: AI-First auto-generated form from JSON Schema. Pass a schema object and get a complete form with validation.

inline.description: Renders form fields in a horizontal row instead of vertical stack

readonly.description: Makes all fields read-only (visible but not editable)

disabled.description: Disables all fields and the submit button

au-submit.description: Detail IS the form values object directly, e.g. { name: 'foo', email: 'bar' }

tips: THE killer feature for AI agents: generate forms from JSON schema without writing HTML
Set schema property (not attribute) to configure the form
Supports string, number, boolean, enum types with automatic widget selection

au-sidebar.name: au-sidebar

open.description: Whether the sidebar is expanded. When closed, collapses to 64px icon rail.

width.description: Width of the sidebar when expanded. Accepts any CSS width value.

tips: Use open attribute to control visibility programmatically

au-skeleton.name: au-skeleton

variant.description: Shape variant (rect=rectangular block, text=line with optional multi-line, circle=round)

size.description: Width and height for circle variant (default: 40px)

lines.description: Number of text lines (only for variant=text)

tips: Use to indicate loading states while fetching async data
For avatar placeholders, use variant=circle with a matching size

au-spinner.name: au-spinner

color.description: Color using MD3 system color tokens (primary, secondary, error, etc.)

tips: Use inside buttons or cards during loading

au-splash.name: au-splash
au-splash.description: Full-screen loading splash screen shown during app initialization

logo.description: URL of the logo image to display during loading

duration.description: Duration in ms before auto-hiding the splash screen

delay.description: Delay in ms before starting the splash animation

spinner.description: Shows a loading spinner below the logo

tips: Automatically hides when all components are loaded

au-stack.name: au-stack
au-stack.description: Flexbox layout component for horizontal/vertical stacking with gap control

gap.description: Spacing between stacked items using standard tokens

justify.description: Main-axis distribution (justify-content). Accepts shortcuts (between, around, evenly) or raw CSS values. Default: flex-start.

wrap.description: Enables wrapping for column direction (row wraps by default)

nowrap.description: Disables wrapping for row direction (column is nowrap by default)

tips: The most common layout primitive â€” use for any flex arrangement

au-switch.name: au-switch

checked.description: Whether the switch is toggled on

disabled.description: Disables the switch and prevents toggling

tips: Use .checked property to get/set state
Listen to au-change for toggle events

au-table.name: au-table
au-table.description: Static HTML table with MD3 styling, striping, and hover effects

striped.description: Alternates row background colors for readability

tips: For dynamic data with sorting/filtering, use au-datatable instead

au-tabs.name: au-tabs
au-tabs.description: MD3 tab navigation with sliding indicator animation
tips: Set active attribute to switch tabs programmatically
Listen for au-tab-change to update content panels

au-textarea.name: au-textarea
au-textarea.description: Multi-line text input with Material Design 3 styling

rows.description: Number of visible text lines (textarea height)

disabled.description: Disables the textarea and prevents editing

readonly.description: Makes the textarea read-only (visible but not editable)

tips: Use .value property to get/set content
au-input fires on keystroke, au-change on blur

au-theme-toggle.name: au-theme-toggle
au-theme-toggle.description: Dark/light mode toggle button with sun/moon icon
tips: Place in navbar for global theme switching
Uses AgentUI.Theme.set() internally

au-toast.name: au-toast

severity.description: Visual severity level, controls color and icon

position.description: Screen position for the toast notification

tips: Use duration="0" to prevent auto-dismiss
Call .dismiss() to close programmatically

au-tooltip.name: au-tooltip
au-tooltip.description: Tooltip overlay that appears on hover/focus of parent element

position.description: Tooltip placement relative to the parent element

tips: Wrap the target element inside au-tooltip

au-virtual-list.name: au-virtual-list
au-virtual-list.description: Virtualized list for rendering thousands of items efficiently â€” only visible items are in the DOM

item-height.description: Fixed height of each item in pixels

tips: Essential for large datasets â€” renders only visible items
Set item-height to match your actual row height for accurate scrolling

au-option.name: au-option
au-option.description: Option item for au-dropdown â€” place inside au-dropdown to define selectable options

value.description: The value submitted when this option is selected

examples:
<au-dropdown placeholder="Pick a color">
  <au-option value="red">Red</au-option>
  <au-option value="blue">Blue</au-option>
  <au-option value="green" disabled>Green (unavailable)</au-option>
</au-dropdown>
tips: Text content of au-option is used as the display label
The value attribute is what gets emitted in the au-select event detail

au-tab.name: au-tab
au-tab.description: Individual tab item â€” place inside au-tabs to define tab labels
tips: Tab content is simple text â€” place it as the text content of au-tab
Set the active tab via the 'active' attribute on the parent au-tabs (0-indexed)
au-tabs manages active state and indicator animation automatically on click

au-radio-group.name: au-radio-group
au-radio-group.description: Container for au-radio elements â€” manages selection state and emits change events

name.description: Form field name for the radio group

tips: Wrap au-radio elements in au-radio-group for proper selection management
The value attribute on au-radio-group sets the initially selected radio

au-sidebar-item.name: au-sidebar-item
au-sidebar-item.description: Navigation item for au-sidebar â€” displays icon and label, collapses to icon-only in rail mode

icon.description: Material Symbols icon name displayed beside the label

active.description: Highlights this item as the currently active navigation item

tips: Text content is used as the label â€” hidden when sidebar is in rail/collapsed mode
Listen for au-sidebar-select on the parent au-sidebar for navigation

au-toast-container.name: au-toast-container
au-toast-container.description: Global container for toast notifications â€” add once to your page, toasts are appended here automatically

position.description: Screen position where toasts appear. Default matches Toast.show() default.

examples:
<au-toast-container position="bottom-center"></au-toast-container>

<!-- Show a toast programmatically (recommended) -->
<script>
  import { Toast } from 'agentui-wc';
  Toast.show('Saved!', { severity: 'success' });
</script>
tips: Only one au-toast-container is needed per page
Toasts auto-dismiss after their duration expires
